Articles.Content:
I've started trying to recreate the ISS in KSP following the actual construction missions as closely as possible. So to get things started, I needed a Proton rocket replica with Zarya.

Download complete Zarya module with Proton-K launcher: [http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4309](http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4309)

![JKiR2bMl.png](http://i.imgur.com/JKiR2bMl.png)

Download the Proton-K as subassembly: [http://kerbalx.com/Naito/Proton-K](http://kerbalx.com/Naito/Proton-K)

![HdEKuJdl.png](http://i.imgur.com/HdEKuJdl.png)![eE3Vp4ym.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/eE3Vp4ym.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T01:14:57Z" title="08/09/2015 01:14  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Naito**

I guess proton is K 

\*badum tiss\* 

i like it too
Try making the middle stage out of two Medium tanks instead of one large.

That looks wicked

Makes me wanna try to build a tiny replica with oscarB size boosters! I luv tiny rockets just too cute

With visual mods a suggested by @clivman, I present the ISS Zarya module

![WgYLKVul.png](http://i.imgur.com/WgYLKVul.png)

![JKiR2bMl.png](http://i.imgur.com/JKiR2bMl.png)

Download: [http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4309](http://kerbalx.com/crafts/4309)
Dang it Naito! Please keep this modded (no offence but I have a \*mostly\* stock one going on)

> 
> Dang it Naito! Please keep this modded (no offence but I have a \*mostly\* stock one going on)

LOL!! Link???? I wanna see!!

I'm personally flying it with Infernal Robotics and RemoteTech, just thought I'd make the stock version available to make it more easily accessible.

edit: dang I just found it, sorry I don't visit the builder's forum much! Link is here if anyone is interested:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128783](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128783)

I was wanting to do exactly that! I even have a Unity module built and launched on my Shuttle, just haven't had time to actually put it all together yet. We should collaborate =D

![PSJTZntl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/PSJTZntl.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T04:13:30Z" title="08/09/2015 04:13  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Naito**
These are glorious mate. Really clean accurate designs. I cant wait to see the finished station!

This is looking really nice. Interested to see how you handle the part count (It'll be in the thousands if you keep this level of detail), and the truss assemblies/solar panels. It's a pain to maintain rigidity and if you don't things go BOOM quick with that many parts.
